intro: Retanilla stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf retanilla, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Retanilla stricta is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
